info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern La Paz, north central Yuma, northeastern Imperial and Riverside Counties through 845 PM MST/845 PM PDT/... At 745 PM MST/745 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Quartzsite, or 36 miles north of Martinez Lake, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blythe, Quartzsite, Cibola, Palo Verde, Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Ripley, Yuma Proving Ground, East Blythe, Palm Canyon and Ehrenberg. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 1 and 24. CA Interstate 10 between mile markers 148 and 156. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 65 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
